intro: Cassipourea mossambicensis, commonly known as the African star apple, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and small, white, fragrant flowers. The tree produces edible, star-shaped fruits that are typically harvested when they turn yellow or red. Its botanical features make it a popular ornamental and fruit-bearing plant in warm climates.
